DOC.brief_summary: We hypothesise that the addition of glutamine supplementation to both parenteral nutrition and enteral feeds in surgical newborn infants leads to a reduction in bacterial invasion.
DOC.brief_title: Microbial Invasion During Parenteral Nutrition in Surgical Infants Receiving Glutamine
DOC.criteria: Infants who have undergone surgical procedures for congenital anomalies or Intestinal inflammation who require total parenteral nutrition.
DOC.keyword: Parenteral nutrition, Infants, Dipeotiven, Microbial invasion
